title: Drawing, mid-18th century
medium: Brush and sepia on laid paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: On recto: cartouches, formed by two trees and two dolphins, three birds flying above. Verso: cartouche formed by two trees with two children with fishtail legs riding upon dolphins and above two children in clouds. Alternative suggestion for the upper birds.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, mid-18th century. Brush and sepia on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-493.
